It is the greatest honour to be elected to represent Northwich, Winsford and Middlewich in Parliament.
As your MP, I’ll never shy away from the tough challenges. I’ll remain rooted in the community in which I live, and fight for the place we love and feel proud to call home.
Together, I know we can build a better society for us all - in Mid Cheshire and beyond.
All the best,
Andrew

Advice Surgeries
My weekly advice surgeries take place on a Friday and alternate between online and in-person appointments. The in-person appointments rotate between venues in Northwich, Middlewich and Winsford. Please note that I and my team are only able to provide advice and assistance to residents of Mid Cheshire constituency. You can check which constituency you live in here.
To request an appointment, complete the form below, email Andrew.Cooper.MP@parliament.uk or call the office on 0207 219 7479.
bottom of page

In Parliament
Visiting Parliament
When Parliament is in session
Free tours, run for constituents by Houses of Parliament tour guides, happen on the following days and times while Parliament is sitting:
-
Monday 9am – 12pm
-
Tuesday 9am – 9:50am
-
Tuesday 10:15am – 12pm
-
Wednesday 9am – 9:50am
-
Wednesday 10:15am - 12pm
-
Friday 3:30pm – 5pm
Tours take approximately 75 minutes.
Please drop me an email at andrew.cooper.mp@parliament.uk for further details.
When Parliament is in recess
Outside of the session, Parliament offers tours on a commercial basis. For more information, visit the UK parliament website.
My work in Parliament
You can find out more about my voting record, written contributions, and spoken contributions on the UK Parliament website.
Raising issues
I regularly raise issues on behalf constituents, businesses and organisations in Mid Cheshire. This can be privately, by writing to the relevant ministers, departments or officials, or in public in the House of Commons chamber.
Do you have an issues you would like me to raise? Get in touch.
Early day motions
I regret that as a point of principle, I do not sign any Early Day Motions except in exceptional circumstances. However, I am happy to discuss ways we can get issues on the national agenda and effect meaningful change. Please get in touch if I can help.
